publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-449 Mr Brian Monteith: Extending the Section 28 Consultation Period—That the Parliament notes that a fifth of responses to the Scottish Executive’s consultation on Section 28 arrived after the closing date for submissions; that its circular inviting responses was not as wide as it might have been, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to extend the consultation period for at least a further month. Supported by: Mr Keith Harding*
S1M-449 Extending the Section 28 Consultation Period (lodged on 21 January 2000) Fergus Ewing*

S1M-449 Mr Brian Monteith: Extending the Section 28 Consultation Period—That the Parliament notes that a fifth of responses to the Scottish Executive’s consultation on Section 28 arrived after the closing date for submissions; that its circular inviting responses was not as wide as it might have been, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to extend the consultation period for at least a further month. Supported by: Mr Keith Harding, Fergus Ewing
S1M-449 Extending the Section 28 Consultation Period (lodged on 21 January 2000) Mr David Davidson*

S1M-449 Mr Brian Monteith: Extending the Section 28 Consultation Period—That the Parliament notes that a fifth of responses to the Scottish Executive’s consultation on Section 28 arrived after the closing date for submissions; that its circular inviting responses was not as wide as it might have been, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to extend the consultation period for at least a further month. Supported by: Mr Keith Harding, Fergus Ewing, Mr David Davidson
S1M-449 Extending the Section 28 Consultation Period (lodged on 21 January 2000) Nick Johnston*
S1M-449 Extending the Section 28 Consultation Period (lodged on 21 January 2000) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*

S1M-449 Mr Brian Monteith: Extending the Section 28 Consultation Period-That the Parliament notes that a fifth of responses to the Scottish Executive's consultation on Section 28 arrived after the closing date for submissions; that its circular inviting responses was not as wide as it might have been, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to extend the consultation period for at least a further month. Supported by: Mr Keith Harding, Fergus Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Nick Johnston, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Jamie McGrigor*

S1M-449 Mr Brian Monteith: Extending the Section 28 Consultation Period—That the Parliament notes that a fifth of responses to the Scottish Executive’s consultation on Section 28 arrived after the closing date for submissions; that its circular inviting responses was not as wide as it might have been, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to extend the consultation period for at least a further month. Supported by: Mr Keith Harding, Fergus Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Nick Johnston, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Jamie McGrigor

Supported by: Mr Keith Harding, Fergus Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Nick Johnston, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Jamie McGrigor

S1M-449 Mr Brian Monteith: Extending the Section 28 Consultation Period—That the Parliament notes that a fifth of responses to the Scottish Executive’s consultation on Section 28 arrived after the closing date for submissions; that its circular inviting responses was not as wide as it might have been, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to extend the consultation period for at least a further month. Supported by: Mr Keith Harding, Fergus Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Nick Johnston, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Jamie McGrigor
